title: Lizzo announces Australian tour at FOMO in 2020
text:
Forget the music, here are the most revealing and shocking outfits at this year's biggest Aussie music festival.

FOMO Festival 2020 is fast approaching — and if you weren’t already excited, American singer Lizzo is set to headline.

Arguably one of this year’s most popular artists, Lizzo has found her way into hearts around the world — not just for hits like “Juice” and “Truth Hurts” — but also for the messages of self-love and confidence she includes in everything she does.

The festival — with shows in Brisbane, Adelaide, Sydney and Melbourne and special side shows in Perth and Auckland — will mark Lizzo’s first visit to Australia, who performed at Coachella earlier this year.

RELATED: Laneway Festival’s massive line-up

The singer let slip about the possibility of her coming to Australia earlier this year during an Instagram Live session, when a fan asked her whether she’d be coming to Australia.

Lizzo casually replied that she’d be here in January — before confessing that it hadn’t officially been announced.

RELATED: Fans fume at excuse for cancelled Oz tour

BROCKHAMPTON, Kaytranada and a stack of other artists are set to take to the festival’s stage — and with only one stage, attendees can enjoy all of the acts without worrying about clashes.

VENUES AND DATES

Saturday, January 4: RNA Showgrounds, Brisbane

Sunday, January 5: Elder Park, Adelaide

Friday, January 10: Belvoir Ampitheatre, Perth (BROCKHAMPTON sideshow only)

Saturday, January 11: Parramatta Park, Sydney

Sunday, January 12: Melbourne Showgrounds, Melbourne

Wednesday, January 15: Trust Arena, Auckland

Tickets for all dates are available from the festival’s website.
description: FOMO Festival 2020 is fast approaching — and if you weren’t already excited, American singer Lizzo is set to headline.
